ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: I am convinced of the importance of my prescription medication.
Notes: 1= Agree completely, 0 points; 2= Agree mostly, 0 points; 3= Agree somewhat, 7 points; 4= Disagree somewhat, 7 points; 5= Disagree mostly, 20 points; 6= Disagree completely, 20 points; -1 = Properly skipped; -9 = Missing; -2= Not collected at this time point; -3= Historical missing; -5= Item/Instrument not collected

ElementDescription: I worry that my prescription medication will do more harm than good to me.
Notes: 1= Agree completely, 14 points; 2= Agree mostly, 14 points; 3= Agree somewhat, 4 points; 4= Disagree somewhat, 4 points; 5= Disagree mostly, 0 points; 6= Disagree completely, 0 points; -1 = Properly skipped; -9 = Missing; -2= Not collected at this time point; -3= Historical missing; -5= Item/Instrument not collected

ElementDescription: I feel financially burdened by my out-of-pocket expenses for my prescription medication.
Notes: 1= Agree completely, 2 points; 2= Agree mostly, 2 points; 3= Agree somewhat, 0 points; 4= Disagree somewhat, 0 points; 5= Disagree mostly, 0 points; 6= Disagree completely, 0 points; -1 = Properly skipped; -9 = Missing; -2= Not collected at this time point; -3= Historical missing; -5= Item/Instrument not collected
Sum of adhest1, adhest2, and adhest3 score points, maximum of 36 points; -9=Missing; -1=Properly skipped; -2=Not collected at this time point; -5=Item/Instrument not collected

1= 0 total, low risk for adherence problems (>75% probability of adherence); 2= 2-7 total, medium risk for adherence problems (32-75% probability of adherence); 3= 8+ total, high risk for adherence problems (<32% probability of adherence)
